# UITextChecker

**Class**

An object to check a string (usually the text of a document) for misspelled words.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UITextChecker
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextChecker] spell-checks using a lexicon for a specific language. You can tell it to ignore specific words when spell-checking a particular document and you can have it learn words, which adds those words to the lexicon. You generally use one instance of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextChecker] per document, although you can use a single instance to spell-check related pieces of text if you want to share ignored words and other state.

You may also use a text checker to obtain completions for partially entered words, as well as possible replacements for misspelled words, which you then can present to users.

## Initiating a Spell Check

- **rangeOfMisspelledWord(in:range:startingAt:wrap:language:)**: Initiates a search of a range of a string for a misspelled word.

## Obtaining Word Guesses and Completions

- **guesses(forWordRange:in:language:)**: Returns a list of words that are possible valid replacements for a misspelled word.
- **completions(forPartialWordRange:in:language:)**: Returns an array of strings that are possible completions for a partially entered word.

## Learning and Ignoring Words

- **ignoreWord(_:)**: Tells the text checker to ignore the specified word when spell-checking.
- **ignoredWords**: Returns the words that the text checker ignores when spell-checking.
- **learnWord(_:)**: Tells the text checker to learn the specified word so that it doesn’t evaluate it as misspelled.
- **unlearnWord(_:)**: Tells the text checker to unlearn the specified word.
- **hasLearnedWord(_:)**: Returns whether the text checker has learned the specified word.

## Getting the Available Languages

- **availableLanguages**: Returns the languages that the text checker’s class can perform spell-checking for.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
